headline: Slow Cooker Barbecued Pulled Pork
description: This barbecue pulled pork recipe is terrific served with coleslaw and pickles, Alternately, mound the BBQ pulled pork on hamburger buns and top with coleslaw, thinly sliced onion, and dill pickles for a tasty sandwich.

video.description: Serve the pulled pork with coleslaw and pickles, or mound it on hamburger buns and top with coleslaw and thinly sliced onion and dill pickles.
video.name: Slow Cooker Barbecued Pulled Pork

name: Slow Cooker Barbecued Pulled Pork
recipeIngredient: 2 teaspoons sambal oelek or other Asian chile sauce
4 1/4 pounds boneless pork shoulder, trimmed and cut into 4 pieces
Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium bowl, mix the onion with the ketchup, brown sugar, cider vinegar, molasses, mustard, and sambal oelek.
In a slow cooker, cover the pork with the ketchup mixture. Cook on high until the pork is very tender, about 6 hours.
Transfer the pork to a work surface and, using 2 forks, shred the meat.
Pour the sauce into a large saucepan and bring to a boil. Cook over high heat until thickened, about 15 minutes.
Stir the shredded pork into the sauce, season with salt and pepper, and serve.

review.reviewBody: I pretty much followed the recipe as printed. We enjoyed it, although maybe not quite as good as previous recipe I have used. My husband enjoyed it, so that's a plus. Might add a little honey for some sweetness next time. As I am not a huge fan of BBQ sauces, this was just fine for me and the sauce cooked down to a nice consistency.

This recipe was for those who wanted to use a slow cooker, which is now a very common alternative to the "traditional" methods. Those who hated this recipe, that's your prerogative. To each her own. The bbq sauce uses basic ingredients with a little addition of the sambar oeelek mixed in. I would rather use the rub when cooking the pork, and then add the sauce after the pork is done and taken out of the slow cooker. Overall, as a slow cooker method with the barbecue sauce, it is fine.

I'm not a traditionalist when it comes to BBQ - I just like what tastes good. This recipe was a winner. Pork was tender and the sauce was perfectly flavorful after reducing and adding to the shredded meat. Made exactly as written and I will absolutely make again as it was a big hit with the family.

HORRIBLE! The sauce doesn't thicken, even when you use thickening agents. It doesn't taste like BBQ at all. They try to trick readers into thinking it has 5 stars with over 2,000 ratings. BUT, it doesn't... the whole site averages to 5 stars with that many ratings (honestly, I don't believe that either). This recipe has 11 reviews with 1 star which should be 0 if it was an option. DO NOT MAKE, so many better recipes out there.

Horrible!!! Definitely would NOT call this BBQ for sure! And the 'sauce' did NOT thicken after 15 min of BOILING.
I don't think the pork was all that tender either. We froze half of it to 'doctor' at some other point in time and rinsed off the remaining shredded pork and fed to our dogs. Next time I will read the reviews before spending all the $$ and time to make something. Seems Food & Wine recipes are more 'miss' than 'hit'.

Sorry, but this does not qualify as BBQ. Like Dave Palladini said, slow smoke the pork butt (dry rubbed with coarse salt, black pepper, granulated garlic and paprika) for 3-4 hours, until at least 170 internal temp, the next morning throw it a slow cooker with just some vinegar, water or beer, and some tomato paste or a thick tomato sauce. Skip the sugar, sugar and more sugar in this recipe unless you really have no taste buds. Pull it apart when done, 4-6 hours, and enjoy.
How is this fast? It takes 6 hours and 45 minutes.
Easy, but not a fan of the sauce.

I would rather use my MasterBuilt to smoke my pork roast to an Internal temperature of 203 to 205, wrap mi9t foil, then a couple towels and put it in a coller for an hour than pull it and add an Eastern Carolina Sauce and some Coleslaw (this is not the coleslaw you put on plate and eat), put this all together on a Hamburg bun, and your talking the best sandwich on the face of the planet.
